Hi, Colin,

It's an interesting idea, that you proposed, but I would like to note 
that there is one more way to try to tune some GA parameters (weight 
mutation technique in this discussion). This way involves coding of 
parameters inside the genotype, so the genome not only include 
network information but also has a standalone gene containing weight 
mutation type (let's say 00 -- for proportional, 01 -- for fixed 
number and so on). During the mating, networks and these genes are 
recombinated independently. In this case it's possible that 
individuals that mutate defferently are present at one and the same 
time. Thus a self-tuning is possible (with simultaneous task 
solution!) and I think it's not so time expensive. And also if you 
use some meta-GA, how are you going to set its' parameters? ;)

Best regards,
Yuri
